parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of applications to return in the result-test.

parameters.name: organizationID
parameters.description: ID of the organization to filter on.

parameters.name: application.id
parameters.description:
Application ID.
This will be automatically assigned on create.

get.summary: GetAWSSNSIntegration returns the AWS SNS application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteAWSSNSIntegration deletes the AWS SNS application-integration.

get.summary: GetAzureServiceBusIntegration returns the Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteAzureServiceBusIntegration deletes the Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

get.summary: GetGCPPubSubIntegration returns the GCP PubSub application-integration.

delete.summary: DeleteGCPPubSubIntegration deletes the GCP PubSub application-integration.

post.summary:
GenerateMQTTIntegrationClientCertificate generates an application ID specific TLS certificate
to connect to the MQTT broker.

get.summary: GetPilotThingsIntegration returns the Pilot Things application-integration.

delete.summary: DeletePilotThingsIntegration deletes the Pilot Things application-integration.

post.summary: CreateAWSSNSIntegration creates a AWS SNS application-integration.

put.summary: UpdateAWSSNSIntegration updates the AWS SNS application-integration.

post.summary: CreateAzureServiceBusIntegration creates an Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

put.summary: UpdateAzureServiceBusIntegration updates the Azure Service-Bus application-integration.

post.summary: CreateGCPPubSubIntegration creates a GCP PubSub application-integration.

put.summary: UpdateGCPPubSubIntegration updates the GCP PubSub application-integration.

post.summary: CreatePilotThingsIntegration creates an Pilot Things application-integration.

put.summary: UpdatePilotThingsIntegration updates the Pilot Things application-integration.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

id.description:
Application ID.
This will be automatically assigned on create.

name.description: Name of the application (must be unique).

organizationID.description:
ID of the organization to which the application belongs.
After create, this can not be modified.

payloadCodec.description:
Payload codec.
NOTE: These field have moved to the device-profile and will be removed
in the next major release. When set, the device-profile payload_ fields
have priority over the application payload_ fields.

payloadEncoderScript.description:
Payload encoder script.
NOTE: These field have moved to the device-profile and will be removed
in the next major release. When set, the device-profile payload_ fields
have priority over the application payload_ fields.

payloadDecoderScript.description:
Payload decoder script.
NOTE: These field have moved to the device-profile and will be removed
in the next major release. When set, the device-profile payload_ fields
have priority over the application payload_ fields.

organizationID.description: ID of the organization to which the application belongs.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

publishName.description:
Publish name.
This is the name of the topic or queue.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

credentialsFile.title:
Credentials file.
This IAM service-account credentials file (JSON) must have the following Pub/Sub roles:
* Pub/Sub Publisher

topicName.description:
Topic name.
This is the name of the Pub/Sub topic.

expiresAt.description: Expires at defines the expiration date of the certificate.

headers.description: The headers to use when making HTTP callbacks.

uplinkDataURL.description:
The URL to call for uplink data.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

joinNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for join notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

ackNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for ACK notifications (for confirmed downlink data).
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

errorNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for error notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

statusNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for device-status notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

locationNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for location notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

txAckNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for tx ack notifications (downlink acknowledged by gateway for transmission).
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

integrationNotificationURL.description:
The URL to call for integration notifications.
Deprecated: use event_endpoint_url.

marshaler.description:
Marshaler.
This defines the marshaler that is used to encode the event payload.

eventEndpointURL.description:
Event endpoint URL.
The HTTP integration will POST all events to this enpoint. The request
will contain a query parameters "event" containing the type of the
event.

totalCount.description: Total number of applications available within the result-set.
Total number of integrations available within the result-set.

geolocationToken.description:
Geolocation token.
This token can be obtained from the LoRa Cloud console.

geolocationBufferTTL.description:
Geolocation buffer TTL (in seconds).
When > 0, uplink RX meta-data will be stored in a buffer so that
the meta-data of multiple uplinks can be used for geolocation.

geolocationMinBufferSize.description:
Geolocation minimum buffer size.
When > 0, geolocation will only be performed when the buffer has
at least the given size.

geolocationGNSSPayloadField.description:
GNSS payload field.
This holds the name of the field in the decoded payload object which
contains the GNSS payload bytes.

geolocationGNSSUseRxTime.description:
GNSS use RX time.
In case this is set to true, the resolver will use the RX time of the
network instead of the timestamp included in the LR1110 payload.

geolocationWifiPayloadField.title:
Wifi payload field.
This holds the name of the field in the decoded payload object which
contains an array of objects with the following fields:
* macAddress - e.g. 01:23:45:67:89:ab
* signalStrength - e.g. -51 (optional)

dasToken.description:
Device Application Services token.
This token can be obtained from the LoRa Cloud console.

dasModemPort.description:
Device Application Services modem port (FPort).
ChirpStack Application Server will only forward the FRMPayload to DAS
when the uplink FPort is equal to this value.

dasGNSSPort.description:
Device Application Services GNSS port (FPort).
ChirpStack Application Server will forward the FRMPayload to DAS when
as GNSS payload when the uplink FPort is equal to this value.

dasGNSSUseRxTime.description:
Device Application Services GNSS use RX time.
In case this is set to true, the DAS resolver will use the RX time of the
network instead of the timestamp included in the LR1110 payload.

dasStreamingGeolocWorkaround.description:
Device Application Services streaming geoloc work-around.
This is a temporarily work-around for processing streaming geolocation
data. When enabled, stream records (expected in TLV format) are scanned
for GNSS data (0x06 or 0x07). If found, the ChirpStack Application Server
will make an additional call to the DAS API for resolving the location
using the detected payload.
